days.content: Be patient... Come back on the 1st of December!
Today, compliment someone on something they’ve done or accomplished.
Today, smile at everyone you see.
Donate books, DVDs or other items to your local charity.
Call your grandparents or a friend you haven’t contacted for a while.
Maybe today you could make a donation to a food bank. For instance:
Get outside pick up litter or do something kind for Nature.
Today, think of three things you like about yourself.
Donate supplies to a local animal shelter. For instance, you could pick one of those:
Give someone you know a book you think they would like. You don’t have a book? Maybe buy them a drink.
Bake a batch of cookies and bring some next door (or maybe in your office).
Reach out to spend time with a friend, family member or neighbour who is experiencing loneliness.

Don’t forget yourself! Schedule a pedicure or massage, spend a few hours reading a great book or make time for another activity you love. Being kind to yourself will give you the energy and strength to be kind to others!
Today: give blood, become an organ donor.
Next time you are at the coffee shop give the cashier1 a few pounds to buy the person behind you their morning cup of coffee.
Leave a positive review online of a restaurant (or place) you really like.
Have a conversation with someone who is experiencing homelessness. Maybe buy them a hot drink or something they would appreciate.
Say “please” and “thank you”, maybe hold a door open for someone or offer up your seat.
Write Post-It notes with encouraging messages and leave them in random places.
Make a donation to a charity, it's quite easy to do. Even a single £1 helps.
Take someone out for a drink and pay the bill!
Fight climate change! Here are a few actions you could do:
Donate your clothes. There are always plenty of clothing items that we don’t need in perfect condition ready to be passed on.
Leave only positive comments and responses on social media.
Take the time to listen to someone attentively rather than monopolise the conversation.
Have yourself a very lovely Christmas!
I hope you had a lovely Christmas. Enjoy the time with your family and friends!
